big_picture_notes: Romans is Paul’s most sustained didactic discourse, architected as a rhetorical argument that moves from thesis (1:16–17) through proof (1:18–11:36) to paraenesis (12:1–15:13) and epistolary conclusion (15:14–16:27). Literary glue includes diatribe with an interlocutor, inclusio around righteousness (1:17; woven through 1–8), OT catenae (3:10–18; ch. 4), and the law–faith–Spirit progression. The Spirit’s agency climaxes in ch. 8; chs. 9–11 resolve Israel’s place; chs. 12–15 translate doctrine into lived ethics.

stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (1:1) formal salutation inaugurates the letter; end (1:17) states the thesis (‘the righteous shall live by faith’) that governs the argument. Glue: repeated ‘gospel’ emphasis, Paul’s apostolic self‑presentation, obligation to all nations.

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Epistolary opening with compressed Christology and mission; concludes with grace‑peace benediction. Devices: densely subordinated syntax, title cascade.
Thanksgiving and intercession climax in mutual encouragement. Devices: inclusio around faith, rapport‑building.
Travel intent and debtor language lead to thesis: gospel reveals God’s righteousness by faith. Devices: diatribal anticipation, Hab 2:4 citation.

stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (1:18) introduces revealed wrath contrasting 1:17’s righteousness; end (3:20) concludes no flesh justified by law—law gives knowledge of sin. Glue: diatribe addressing moralist/Jew, ‘God gave them up’ refrain, sin/unrighteousness vocabulary culminating in catena proof.

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: From revelation of wrath to exchange of glory for images. Devices: cause→effect logic, general revelation culpability.
First ‘God gave them up’; dishonor of bodies and passions detailed. Devices: refrain as structural marker, antithetical contrasts.
Final ‘gave them up’ to depraved mind; catalog of vices; approval of evil. Devices: vice list, paradox of consent.
Apostrophe to the judging ‘O man’; storing up wrath. Devices: diatribe turn, reversal of judgment.
Render to each; Jew first and Greek; no partiality. Devices: parallelism, inclusio by 2:11.
Perish with/without law; conscience as witness; day when God judges secrets. Devices: thesis‑explanation unit, inner law motif.
‘You who…’ participles expose hypocrisy; Scripture indicts blasphemy among nations. Devices: anaphoric charge, OT citation.
Outward vs inward; letter vs Spirit; praise from God. Devices: antithesis, identity redefinition.
Advantages of Jew; God’s truth vs human falsehood; slander refuted. Devices: diatribal Q&A, ethical clarification.

scenes.scene_name: All Under Sin: Catena and Verdict
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Charge of universal sin; OT catena as evidence; law silences mouths. Devices: chain citation, forensic conclusion.

stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (3:21) ‘But now’ introduces God’s righteousness apart from law; end (5:21) closes Adam–Christ contrast with grace reigning to life. Glue: righteousness/faith terminology, Abraham/David witnesses, and typological Adam–Christ parallel.

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Manifest righteousness through Christ’s propitiation; God just and justifier. Devices: dense soteriological lexicon (hilastērion, redemption).
Where then boasting? By law of faith; law established. Devices: diatribal objections, paradox resolution.
Gen 15:6 and Ps 32 ground justification apart from works. Devices: exegetical proof, dual witness.
Timing proves universality; father of circumcised/uncircumcised. Devices: logical sequencing, boundary marker argument.
Heir of the world via faith; God who gives life to dead. Devices: promise–law antithesis, divine causation.
Against hope he believed; faith credited as righteousness. Devices: paradox, narrative commendation.

scenes.scene_name: For Our Sake; Fruits of Justification
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Crediting written for us; peace, access, hope; suffering chain to hope by Spirit’s love. Devices: application bridge, experiential sequence.
Christ died for the ungodly; much‑more logic; reconciliation joy. Devices: a fortiori reasoning, assurance.

scenes.scene_name: Adam and the Entrance of Sin
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Sin/death through one; Adam a type. Devices: typology introduction, problem setup.
Gift not like trespass; grace reigns in life. Devices: antithesis, contrast amplification.
As–so summary; law enters to increase trespass; grace reigns to life. Devices: parallelism, climactic summary.

stories.story_title: Sanctification and Life in the Spirit
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Shifts from declared righteousness (3–5) to lived holiness (6–8). Glue: diatribal questions (6:1, 15; 7:7, 13), law‑sin analysis, and Spirit’s saturating presence culminating in assurance and love in ch. 8.

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: ‘Shall we continue in sin?’ By no means; united to Christ’s death/raising. Devices: diatribe, baptismal union analogy.
Know old self crucified; reckon dead to sin; yield to God. Devices: threefold imperative rhythm, dominion contrast.
‘Shall we sin?’ Not under law but grace; wages vs gift. Devices: diatribe, slavery metaphor, antithetical close.
Marriage death analogy; serve in newness of Spirit. Devices: legal analogy, new‑covenant contrast.
Is the law sin? By no means; law exposes and occasions sin. Devices: diatribe, experiential ‘I’ explanation.
I do not do the good I will; who will deliver me? Devices: lament climax, thanksgiving turn to Jesus Christ.

scenes.scene_name: No Condemnation; Life in the Spirit
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Law of Spirit of life; Spirit indwells and gives life. Devices: forensic declaration→indwelling motif.
Led by Spirit; Abba cry; co‑heirs with Christ. Devices: adoption imagery, suffering‑with to glory‑with.

scenes.scene_name: Suffering, Hope, and the Spirit’s Help
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Creation’s groaning; hope’s patience; Spirit intercedes. Devices: triadic groaning, eschatological tension.
All things for good; foreknew→predestined→called→justified→glorified. Devices: golden chain, aorist sweep.
If God is for us… nothing separates us from love in Christ. Devices: rhetorical barrage, victory crescendo.

stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Addresses Israel’s status under the gospel: sovereign purpose (9), human responsibility (10), and future mercy (11). Glue: heavy OT citation, remnant motif, olive tree metaphor, and closing doxology.

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Great sorrow; adoption, covenants, promises; Christ according to flesh. Devices: oath emphasis, privilege list.
Not all Israel are Israel; Isaac/Jacob over Ishmael/Esau. Devices: identity redefinition, prenatal oracle citations.
Is God unjust? By no means; mercy on whom he wills; Pharaoh. Devices: diatribe, Exodus citation.
Who resists his will? Potter’s right; vessels of mercy. Devices: rhetorical rebuke, metaphor argument.

scenes.scene_name: Hosea and Isaiah on the Remnant
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Called ‘not my people’; only a remnant saved. Devices: catena citations, remnant theme.
Gentiles by faith; Israel pursuing law stumbled at Christ. Devices: pursuit metaphor, stone citations.

scenes.scene_name: Word Near You: Confess and Believe
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Righteousness by faith speaks; heart‑believe/mouth‑confess; ‘everyone who calls’. Devices: Deut citation, universal call.
How will they hear without a preacher? Israel disobeyed. Devices: stepwise logic, Isaiah echo.
Has God rejected his people? By no means; Elijah remnant; grace not works. Devices: diatribe, remnant proof.
Their trespass riches for Gentiles; olive tree grafting; warning to Gentile pride. Devices: metaphor admonition, purpose reversal.

scenes.scene_name: Mystery: All Israel Will Be Saved
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Partial hardening until fullness; irrevocable calling; all imprisoned to show mercy. Devices: revealed mystery, mercy inclusio.
Depth of wisdom; from, through, to him are all things. Devices: hymnic doxology, rhetorical seal.

stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Paraenetic turn signaled by ‘therefore’ (12:1); doctrine becomes practice—worship, gifts, love, authorities, and mutual forbearance, culminating in Jew–Gentile harmony. Glue: imperative chains, love fulfillment of law, weak/strong dynamics.

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Present bodies; non‑conformity; transformation by mind renewal. Devices: cultic metaphor, hinge ‘therefore’.
Think soberly; one body, many members; exercise gifts. Devices: body metaphor, gift list.
Sincere love; bless persecutors; overcome evil with good. Devices: staccato imperatives, antithesis.
No authority except from God; pay dues. Devices: theological ground for civil obedience.

scenes.scene_name: Love Fulfills the Law; Put on Christ
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Owe no one anything but love; salvation nearer; put on the Lord Jesus Christ. Devices: day/night contrast, clothing metaphor.
Do not despise/judge; each stands before his own master. Devices: paired exhortations, lordship rationale.
Pursue peace; kingdom is righteousness, peace, joy; whatever is not of faith is sin. Devices: conscience ethic, kingdom focus.
Christ did not please himself; harmony to glorify God. Devices: example of Christ, unity telos.
Christ a servant to circumcision; Gentiles glorify God; hope by the Spirit. Devices: citation cluster, benedictory wish.

stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Returns to epistolary mode: Paul’s ministry rationale, Spain/collection plans, commendations, greetings, a warning, and doxology. Glue: repeated ‘greet’/‘commend,’ travel logistics, and final praise that seals the letter.

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Bold writing to remind; priestly service of the gospel; aim where Christ not named. Devices: ethos appeal, ambition motif.
Hindered until now; collection for saints; prayer for deliverance and joy. Devices: travel plan, intercession request.
Diakonos and prostatis; receive her worthily. Devices: commendation formula, honorifics.
Greet list of coworkers/households; holy kiss. Devices: name‑chain, communal tapestry.
Watch for dividers; be wise to good; the God of peace will soon crush Satan. Devices: paraenesis, Genesis echo.
Tertius writes; others greet. Devices: scribe note, hospitality mention.
Now to him who is able… revelation of the mystery… everlasting glory. Devices: doxological seal, gospel‑mystery summary.
